definition: by the way/while out doing sth else/conveniently
to obey/to follow/to arrange/to make reasonable/along/favorable

sentences.english: And when I stopped by at a convenience store in Nagoya, I found this.
sentences.chinese: 当我顺路去名古屋的便利店时，我找到了这个。

sentences.english: He used to drop in for coffee when he went to work.
sentences.chinese: 过去他上班时，常顺路去喝咖啡。

sentences.english: Would it be convenient if I dropped by today?
sentences.chinese: 如果今天我顺路去找你，不会有什么不方便吧？

sentences.english: If you don't mind, I'll call by at 5 and pick up my books.
sentences.chinese: 如果你不介意，我今天5点会顺路去你那儿取我的书。

sentences.english: Located along Jiangtai Road, south of Holiday Inn Lido Beijing. Short drive to the airport.
sentences.chinese: 位于京顺路，丽都酒店的南面，去首都机场很方便。

sentences.english: Up the road, in his shack, the old man was sleeping again.
sentences.chinese: 顺路而上，小木屋里，老人又沉沉地睡去。

sentences.english: I must look into the garage on the way home to book a service for the car.
sentences.chinese: 回家时我得顺路到汽车修理厂去预约检修汽车的事情。

sentences.english: The women picked up their babies in the nursery on their any home from the factory.
sentences.chinese: 妇女们从工厂回家，顺路到托儿所把要婴孩带回。

sentences.english: He usually drops the kids off at school on his way to work.
sentences.chinese: 他通常在开车上班时顺路把孩子们接送到学校。

sentences.english: I use double-Shun to walk or use double-ching.
sentences.chinese: 我要用双顺路来走路，或者用双清。

sentences.english: It has been suggested that commuters should share their cars and give each other lifts.
sentences.chinese: 有人建议通勤者合用车辆，并让彼此搭顺路车。

sentences.english: I'll swing by your house this afternoon.
sentences.chinese: 今天下午我会顺路到你家去。

sentences.english: She got a job in Beijing, on the way to visit yaohui.
sentences.chinese: 她在北京找了份保姆的工作，顺路来探望耀辉。

sentences.english: Don't forget to call in on your way home.
sentences.chinese: 别忘了你回家时顺路来这里玩玩。

sentences.english: He thumbed his way to Nottingham.
sentences.chinese: 他要求搭顺路车去诺丁汉。

sentences.english: Please stop by the cleaner's on your way home and collect my coat.
sentences.chinese: 回来时请顺路去一下洗衣店把我的外套取来。

definition: to bring sth to sb/to deliver
to make a detour/to take the long route
(coll.) to ride in sb else's car to save money/to ride on a train or bus without buying a ticket (fare-dodging)
to take the car, bus, train etc
to ride (in a vehicle)/to get a lift/to hitch-hike
to roam around/to have a stroll
